metadata.case_name: Idol of Thakurji Shri Govind Deoji Maharaj v. State of Rajasthan & Ors.

facts.text: Several lands granted to the Idol of Thakurji Shri Govind Deoji Maharaj from time to time in the name of the Idol.
Seva Pooja of the Idol and management of its properties entrusted to the Goswami since the Idol was taken to Jaipur from Brindaban.
Goswami Shri Krishna Chandra succeeded to Shebaitship in 1888 and managed until 1935.
Goswami Bhola Nath, eldest son of Krishna Chandra, succeeded in 1935 and managed until 1945.
Goswami Pradumna Kumar, eldest son of Bhola Nath, succeeded in 1945 and has been managing properties and Seva Pooja.
Board of Revenue (respondent No. 1) passed order on November 6, 1956, directing recovery of Matalaba Matmi Rs. 15,404/14/6 from Shebait of appellant temple.
Matmi sanctioned in favour of Goswami Bhola Nath on death of Krishna Chandra and in favour of Pradumna Kumar on death of Bhola Nath.
Appellant filed Writ Petition No. 10 of 1957 in Rajasthan High Court challenging recoverability of amount from appellant.
Rajasthan High Court dismissed writ petition on September 10, 1959.
Patta dated 21st Ramzan St. 1123 (Annexure Exbt. 4) allotted villages Dehra and Salampukh Balahadi for Punya Bhog of Thakurji Sriji.
Patta dated Katik Badi 8 of Smt. 1808 (Annexure Exbt. 5) allotted village Govindpur Bas Hathyod for Bhog of Thakurji Sriji.
Respondents stated allegation of grants to Idol not admitted as original grant documents not traceable.
Lands granted to appellant resumed by State of Rajasthan by notification No. F. 388 REV/1.A/53 dated January 1, 1959.
State sanctioned annual annuity to Deity by order dated April 24, 1962, but directed deduction of Rs. 15,404/14/6 Matmi.

legal_issues.text: Whether under rule 5 of the Jaipur Matmi Rules, 1945, the appellant Idol is liable to pay the Matmi amount.

petitioner_arguments.text: Properties granted to the Idol itself; Shebaits perform Seva Pooja and manage as Shebaits, not as grantees.
Impugned order and prior order dated April 20, 1954 should be quashed; prohibit recovery from petitioner's estate.

respondent_arguments.text: Allegation of grants to Idol not admitted; documents not traceable. Matalaba Matmi properly levied against Shebaits.

court_reasoning.text: Grants made in favour of the Idol, not Shebaits. High Court proceeded on basis that Idol is owner.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Grants supported by Pattas showing allotment for Bhog/Punya Bhog of Thakurji Sriji.

court_reasoning.text: Religious grant to Idol; Shebait manages by virtue of Shebaitship, not as State grantee.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Idol is juridical person, not subject to death; no successor, hence no Matmi (mutation on death of holder).

court_reasoning.text: Shebait's beneficial interest derived from Hindu law, not State grant.
court_reasoning.key_observation: High Court erred in treating Shebait's beneficial interest as State grant under r.4(1).

court_reasoning.text: All properties treated as granted to Idol based on writ petition averments and High Court approach.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Respondents did not prove otherwise despite opportunity.

holdings.text: Properties granted to Idol constitute State grants under r.4(1) but not liable to Matmi under r.5 as no death of grantee or successor.

precedents_cited.case_name: Tilkayat Shri Govindlalji Maharaj etc. v. State of Rajasthan Ors.
Vidya Varuthi Thirtha Swamigal v. Balusami Ayyar
precedents_cited.relevance: Observations of Ameer Ali J. on Mahant's beneficial interest from usage/custom, not vesting as trustee.

statutes_cited.name: Jaipur Matmi Rules, 1945
statutes_cited.relevance: Define State grant, Matmi, Nazarana; levy on State grants subject to exceptions; succession rules; exemption possible under r.20.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed; prayer to restrain respondents from recovering Matmi from appellant's estate granted. No opinion on validity of order against Shebait.
outcome.relief_granted: Prohibit recovery of Rs. 15,404/14/6 Matmi from appellant's estate; prayer in para 16(1) of writ petition allowed.

key_quotes.text: An Idol which is a juridical person is not subject to death, because the Hindu concept is that the Idol lives for ever, and so, it is plainly impossible to predicate about the Idol which is the grantee in the present case that it has died at a certain time and the claims of a successor fall to be determined.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core reasoning why no Matmi liability for grant to Idol.

key_quotes.text: Matmi means mutation of the name of the successor to a State grant on the death of the last holder.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Definition under r.4(3) key to holding no applicability to perpetual Idol.
